title: Parts of the registration form are not localized
body:
**Describe the bug**
Parts of the registration form and e-mails do not reflect language settings (tried Spanish, French, Czech). These are:
- *Field names* (e.g. First name, …) – they seem defined in Transifex, but not translated in the form. I understand that mess will occur universally, when someone defines a new unknown field.
- If the registration is done by manager, there is a section called "Email notification"
- Last two lines in the registration form:
```
(All the fields marked with * are mandatory)
Register
```
- In the e-mail sent with registration details, part of the text is hardcoded, seems to come from modules/events/registration/templates/emails/registration_creation_to_registrant.html

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Login as Indico user
2. Click on Registration
3. Fill it
3. Scroll down.
4. See error, read mail, see error

**Expected behavior**
Register button text and the note before it should be localizable.

body:

![timetable1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7440294/6289748/a11f8a66-b922-11e4-89e0-968e34fb793d.png)

This can be solved only afterwards by going back and edit this block after creation and deleting the unwanted (double) sub-title.

title: Line breaks in description are ignored in reminders
body:
**Describe the bug** Indico v3.2.1 and newer ignores line breaks and paragraph changes in the description block of reminder emails. This problem did not occur with version 3.2 and earlier. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Create an event with a multi-line/multi-paragraph description, e.g.: ```

Title: Lecture I

Speaker: Speaker I (Institute I)

Abstract: First things first.

``` if viewed as a html source. 2. Add a reminder 3. Tick the __Include description__ option 4. __Preview email__ 5. The description block displays the above three paragraphs in a single line: ``` Description ----------- Title: Lecture ISpeaker: Speaker I (Institute I)Abstract: First things first. Note ---- ======== zoom connection ============================================= Link, meeting ID and passcode are available on the indico page. ====================================================================== -- Indico :: Email Notifier ``` **Expected behavior** Indico v3.2 would format the description block like: ``` Description ----------- Title: Lecture I Speaker: Speaker I (Institute I) Abstract: First things first. ``` **Additional context** The note block is still intact.

title: Unexpected behavior when editing session slot start time
body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

The validation of start time modification of a session slot in the timetable view is not working as expected when there are contributions living inside. 

To reproduce the issue, first assume the following session:

```
14:00 --- Session start ---
    14:10 ~ 15:00 Contribution
15:00 --- Session end ---
```

Trying to modify the start time of the session from 14:00 to 14:10 triggers an error dialog with the following message:

  The session slot cannot end at (2014-10-12 14:50) because there is a contribution (2014-10-12 15:00) ending after that time.

So it seems that instead of pushing back by 10 minutes the end time, we are doing the opposite and thus triggering the error message.

This problem is reproducible both from the session details qtip and basic edition dialog.

title: Removing entry of Division from Room Details does not work
body:
**Describe the bug**
The entry of the non mandatory field Division from the room details can not be removed.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the 'Edit Room Details' of a room that contains Division information.
2. Remove the Entry.
3. Click Save.
4. The message "Room has been successfully updated." appears
5. The old value of division is back again (both in the edit view and the room list)

**Workaround**
As a workaround I inserted a non breaking space (U+00A0) via copy paste into the field, as a normal white space does not work. The division field disappears from the room list and the division field in the edit dialog is now empty. Not sure if this behavior is an additional bug.

**Expected behavior**
The old value of division is removed when cleared in the edit room details form and saved.

**Additional context**
indico 2.2.8 is installed via pip.

```
Hi,

This has been bugging me for a long time and it seems I am not the only
one to suffer from this:

In LHCb, we have this extremely useful "meetings of the week" overview
page,
http://indico.cern.ch/categOverview.py?selCateg=1l22&period=week&detail=conference
Many of us use this as an extremely convenient entry point to indico.
When I then go to one of the meetings, I am typically asked for my "CERN
authentication", since most of our meetings are protected (as they
should be). So I log in and check the agenda of this meeting. Next, I
usually want to go back to the "meetings of the week" overview page to
check some other meeting. There is no "back" button in the web page so I
use the "back" button of my browser. But this does not work. Rather, I
get the annoying message:

------------


    Please wait at least 20 seconds between 2 logon attempts.

The request has been rejected because it appears to be a duplicate of a
request from this same client browser session within the last 20 seconds.

------------

although the overview page is NOT protected. And if I have the patience
to wait these 20 sec and then try again, I am taken to the indico home
page, not the LHCb "meetings of the week" overview page that I wanted to
get back to.

It would be extremely nice if this could be fixed.


Best regards,
Olaf Steinkamp
```

title: Switching room booking calendar from month view to week back to month changes view to be the previous month
body:
**Describe the bug**

When you start on the default day view, then switch to month view, then week view, then back to the month view, you end up on the previous month. Users find this confusing. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'room booking' (/rooms/book)
2. Click on 'bookings' (/rooms/calendar)
3. Click on 'Month' (/rooms/calendar?date=2024-06-01&mode=months&view=timeline)
4. Click on 'Week' (/rooms/calendar?date=2024-05-26&mode=weeks&view=timeline)
5. Click on 'Month' (/rooms/calendar?date=2024-05-01&mode=months&view=timeline)

You are now looking at the month view for the previous month, but that would be unexpected for the user. 

**Expected behavior**
If the month view is the current month, when switching to the week view, show the current week. 

The behavior of FullCalendar in the Events section is more intuitive.  It tracks an anchor date for the calendar (I'm not sure of what that's called in FullCalendar's api). 

Examples behavior for FullCalendar: 

- When you first start, the anchor date is "today" so if you switch from Month, to Week, it shows the current week. When you switch back to "day" it shows today. 
- In the month view, if you go back a month, the new anchor date is the first of the previous month, so if you switch to the week view it shows the week with that day in it, but if you switch to the day view, it shows the 1st of the month

title: Submit New Abstact Form: user forced to re-fill the form when 2+ authors and, speaker or contribution type or track is required but not chosen.
body:
When a user goes to submit an abstract and there are two or more authors. If a speaker or a contribution type or a track is required and one is not selected the form fails and the authors list becomes blank with no way to add authors. The user must cancel and re-fill out the form.

**To Reproduce**
1. Allow and Require a speaker and a contribution type and a track in the submission settings.
2. User clicks on 'Submit New Abstract' button
3. Fill in the form with **more than one author**. It does not seem to matter how the authors are entered (manually, search...), just that there are 2 or more. It works as expected with a single author.
4. Do not select one or more of: author as speaker, contribution type, or track.
5. Hit Submit

It will give an error message, but the authors list is empty with no way to add any. The form must be canceled and restarted.

It works as expected with a single author. It also works with multiple authors if none of the above errors occur.

**Expected behavior**
It should give an error message saying a speaker wasn't selected (or contrib. type or track) and let you select one.

**Screenshots**
![screen-speaker-error](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/20404184/fcd0a14b-b357-4740-b2c5-46653dba2a2a)
![screen-speaker-error-1](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/20404184/f9662413-e5be-41fb-94df-e6b7279e53f5)


**Additional context**
Indico v3.2.8 running on Debian Bullseye

I have not tried various combinations of speaker/contrib. type/track being required. They were all required on the event where the error appeared.

I noticed that when I cloned the form from the previous school (http://indico.cern.ch/conferenceDisplay.py?confId=106673), all the fields in the form were automatically marked as mandatory, despite the fact that on the form I cloned there were several fields not marked as mandatory.

I've made the changes now - but wanted to let you know - and to see whether this is a default of Indico or if there is a problem with cloning registration forms? As we will be doing similar clones for future schools and it can take quite a bit of time to go through the form and remove the mandatory fields.

Many thanks for any information you can give me.

best regards
Kate

Kate ROSS
Assistant to the PH Department Head
PH Department

title: A timezone which leads to "day-wrapping" seems to confuse the timetable rendering code
body:
**Describe the bug**

This happened in an event happening in `Europe/Zurich` as seen in `Asia/Seoul`.

e.g. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117990951-e87fd200-b33d-11eb-83f1-af8664afa3bf.png)

becomes:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117991075-03eadd00-b33e-11eb-93bf-bff4f5eb138b.png)

Which seems OK, only that the second day is incorrectly rendered:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117991168-182eda00-b33e-11eb-8ff9-552156b35ce4.png)

(that last green block should have been at midnight)

In detailed view things get even worse:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117991386-47dde200-b33e-11eb-9a95-dc9f4d669ddd.png)

becomes:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117991672-8ffd0480-b33e-11eb-91ac-da6699987133.png)(these should be on Tuesday, not here)
[plus, further down the page...]

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2699/117991515-68a63780-b33e-11eb-8d45-3be8a93f8364.png)

(only this last part is correct)


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open https://indico.cern.ch/event/1016060/timetable/#20210510;
2. Set your timezone to `Asia/Seoul`;
3. You will notice the timetable is a bit of a mess.

**Expected behavior**

The time should be offset of 7h, with the "first day" of the event starting at  21:00 and finishing already on Tuesday (at 1:10 local time). The last two talks of the day should be shown on the day after.

**Additional context**
Reported at CERN, through `INC2786935`

title: Registration form "add section" constructs incorrect URL
body:
I'm running indico 1.9.6, and I'm trying to add a new section to a registration form for a conference.  While editing the registration form, I can click on Add New --> Section, and I'm prompted for the title of the new section and I can click "Add", but the new section never appears.

A similar thing happens when I try to use the "+" to add a new field.  The operation doesn't appear to fail, but the new field doesn't appear.

 My site has a name like "http://example.com/indico".  Looking at the httpd access logs, I see that most requests ask for "/indico/...", but the POST that attempts to add a new section asks for "/event/...", leaving off the "/indico", and getting a 404 error.  Looking through the code, I don't see where this request is constructed.

For now, I've worked around the bug by using an Apache mod_rewrite rule to rewrite the bad URL.  With that change, sections can be added with no problem.

Expect `a.arrow.js-dropdown` to have `aria-controls` pointing to the menu items, and `aria-expanded` that reflects its state.


**Additional context**

- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/name-role-value.html

title: Fix validation on latitude/longitude fields when editing rooms

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
Currently they don't specify any `step`, so the default step is `1`. This of course doesn't work well for coordinates (Firefox: validation error after editing; Edge: validation error when just submitting the form w/o changing the coordinates), so we can either:

- specify `step="0.000000001"` (with a reasonable amount of zeroes) or
- use a normal `type="text"` field

I think using a text field is the better option here, since having the up/down arrows for number input fields isn't useful in this case either.

title: Template rendering results in Invalid HTML

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
For an event with one or more badge/poster, the rendered page for /event/<event_id>/manage/designer/ results in invalid html -- as the template logic results in multiple elements with same html id. An example of one such error (as reported by online validation service at html5.validator.nu) is:

Error: Duplicate ID template-list.
From line 777, column 13; to line 777, column 61
          <table class="i-table-widget" id="template-list">

Problem encountered running on 2.2-maintenance commit fee7cad5912b20d2e3d64bbad14571cb11c852e8 -- and raised in this forum discussion:
https://talk.getindico.io/t/how-to-extend-a-core-template-macro/1363/13

To Reproduce: select an event with one or more badge or poster templates, and validate the source HTML.

title: PDF files uploaded with wrong content type
body:
It seems some PDF files are uploaded with `application/x-download` as content type. It seems caused by some weird configuration in [pretty old](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=373621) versions of Firefox. There are currently over 200 instances of this issue in the production DB. Trying to preview the file causes an error since the content type is not supported.

I see two possible lines of action:
- Support `application/x-download` in the PDF previewer.
- Translate `application/x-download` to `application/pdf` on upload.

title: TypeAhead Widget not working with some Validators, like HiddenUnless
body:
**Describe the bug**
When you combine TypeAhead Widget with attributes for validators added at render_field function, it won't work because those validators won't be added 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any registration form (in my case, I went to RegistrationFormForm)
2. Add a first (A) StringField with HiddenUnless validator and TypeaheadWidget
3. Add a second (B) StringField only with HiddenUnless validator
4. Activate the field that triggers the HiddenUnless, it will only work on B.

**Expected behavior**
I expect the HiddenUnless validator (and other extra validators) to work in combination with Typeahead widget.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11741165/130426378-0acd5409-b088-454a-9e5f-3969e9b78c57.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11741165/130426268-30742d8f-a0d9-4f5b-9f13-d53d6d96d432.png).


**Additional context**
I'm not sure if this issue is afecting to more widgets. For example I think it is afecting to the ckeditor_widget, but I have not tested it.

milestone.title: v0.97.0

body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
# Reported by: dmartinc
```

How to reproduce:

-With IE8, create a meeting, go to timetable, add new->session (or contribution).
-Click in the "title" field. Write a name. Click on the "add existing" button to add a convener / presenter. Write something in one of the user search dialog's fields, and press the Enter key to launch the search.
-The search should be launched, but the Enter key also activates the "Add" button of the first dialog (session / contribution creation). Therefore the session / contribution is added to the timetable without the convener / presenter and the user search dialog is still "floating" over the page.

Note: observe that in IE8, the "Add" button starts with some kind of shading that seems to indicate it has focus. It loses the shading when clicking on "Add Existing" but that does not stop it from being pressed with the "Enter" key.

I could reproduce with indicows 's IE8 (version 8.0.6001.18702CO) but not with cernts.cern.ch's IE7, where this works fine.

title: Some icons are audible
body:
**Describe the bug**

The current icon set contains characters that are in the screen-reader-readable range causing them to be read out loud (e.g., '$', 'F', etc.).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the main page, making sure that there are categories shown with the "right arrow" icon
2. Use a screen reader to read the category page
3. Observe that the arrow is read out as "F"

**Expected behavior**

Icons should not be announced.

title: Localization: Date format in header should be locale dependent
body:
**Describe the bug**
Currently, in event header, the date is formatted using the format_event_date macro.
This macro relies on English locale custom for formatting the event date, which may not be OK for non-English languages.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to main page of an event.
2. Switch to a different language
3. See the date format in the event header stay the same, e.g. 1-13 listopada for Polish.

**Expected behavior**
The date format should reflect the language, e.g. probably be set by a translation template.
For Czech it would be 12.–14. září (for example).

**Additional context**
The macro in question is in modules/events/templates/display/conference/_util.html

title: Paper Editing UI: Misleading "refresh" symbol next to uploaded file name
body:
**Describe the bug**

After uploading my paper I clicked the "refresh" symbol ([similar to this](https://cdn2.vectorstock.com/i/1000x1000/39/96/refresh-or-reload-symbol-blue-circular-arrow-vector-21433996.jpg)) that appeared next to my file, thinking that clicking that button was needed to actually upload the file. Instead, that was an "undo" button that restored the old version of my paper.

This behavior was counterintuitive _for me_ and the UI didn't lead me to do the right thing. Of course it's a totally subjective matter and maybe other people don't have the same misconception.
I'm suggesting better communication in the UI of the consequences of my actions.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
A feedback box with a message describing the result of my action, such as "File restored".

title: event description and custom page content html tag attributes
body:
**Describe the bug** in older versions of indico, I could create custom event sites and custom pages via switching to source mode in the editor and paste my custom html with many class attributes and then style them with a custom layout css file. now, on indico 3.2, these customized events still display correctly, but the new editor removes all my custom attributes and tags I was using, hence changes or a completely new site with custom styled tags are not possible anymore. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: create an event try to set custom html, i.e. `
hello
` **Expected behavior** on saving, indico should keep the html as entered when the editor was set to source mode. this worked in older indico versions (2.8 or 3.0? not sure unfortunately) **Screenshots** here is the old html I created in the older indico version, and styled it with the custom layout css ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45198837/203851567-55a478b0-6a23-4bcc-bfb1-60e029366313.png) heres what the description editor loads when trying to edit it. if I would save now, all my custom classes would be gone. ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45198837/203851661-90b4d4eb-bf2c-409f-ad3f-71644e5c7441.png) any possibility to get this functionality back, aka dont sanitize too much? or add a button where I can upload a custom html and use it i.e. as the event descripton or as content of a custom page. thanks alot!

In a conference where the manager has chosen a "default style" different from "parallel", if the user goes to the display page for the timetable, he can no longer change the layout with which to view the timetable.

Example:
http://indico.cern.ch/conferenceOtherViews.py?view=nicecompact&confId=55201

versus

title: Minutes editor colores text is <span>: problem with inline minutes
body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
# Reported by: dmartinc
```

If the user gives color to part of the text minutes with the HTML minutes editor (fckeditor), the editor uses a <span> tag with a style.

If minutes are displayed inline in a meeting page, those colored text parts appear separated from the sourrounding text because Indico's CSS is applying display:block to all <span> in a meeting display page.

So, we should either avoid to apply CSS to non-classed <span> and use always <span class="..."> or somehow make it so that Indico's CSS is not applied inside inline minutes / description HTML.
